rename.from: typedRoutes: `Link[href]`s to `route.ts` paths reported as problems
rename.to: typedRoutes: `Link[href]`s to GET `route.ts` paths reported as problems

body: In the [docs](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/config/typescript#end-to-end-type-safety) it's not mentioned that `route.ts` are typed, it seems it's a `page.tsx` feature only

@kyrylolvov did you read my issue description above? (specifically the part where I link to the existing implementation)

It definitely was implemented with `experimental.typedRoutes` - we have many CI runs to prove it.

> [@kyrylolvov](https://github.com/kyrylolvov) did you read my issue description above? (specifically the part where I link to the existing implementation)
> 
> It definitely was implemented with `experimental.typedRoutes` - we have many CI runs to prove it.

Yeah, I read that it was implemented before. Just saying in the stable docs it's only mentioned it's for routing between pages

Ok, understood.

As far as I understand, the new implementation is intended to be a superset of the existing `experimental.typedRoutes` feature, so in my understanding this omission is not intentional.

Thanks for the repro! I'm curious why you're linking to an API route? For this implementation I did decide to focus on linking between pages, partially for DX reasons (that way Link autocomplete doesn't show tons of internal routes). But if it's a common use case we might rethink that.

Linking to resources outside of Next.js pages, which can require Route Handlers for personalization or dynamic generation reasons:

- compiled HTML pages
- PDFs
- other downloads (CSVs, ZIPs, etc)
- dynamically generated files from Route Handlers

It was already accepted as a valid use case in https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/46742#issuecomment-1470968002

Also adding my 5 cents here why to add routes:
I have `/logout` route for example - quite common thing

If that could be DX issue for other ppl maybe there should be at least an extra option to configure it?

issue.title: fix: typesafe linking to route handlers and pages API routes

body: What advantage do you get from using `` for API routes instead of ``? I noticed the same change in behavior, but in my case I had a link like ```tsx }>Download ``` where I was using `satisfies` to explicitly make sure I didn’t typo the link to the route handler. I don’t know what reason there is to use `` when it’s not a client-side transition, though
Well, if you use `Link` you don't have to use `satisfies Route`

I can confirm that [`next@15.5.1-canary.4`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/releases/tag/v15.5.1-canary.4) this made the TS type errors disappear 🎉

Thanks @bgub , super fast! 🚀
This closed issue has been automatically locked because it had no new activity for 2 weeks. If you are running into a similar issue, please create a new issue with the steps to reproduce. Thank you.
